meanings.definition: One who persuades others to commit perjury or other crimes.
meanings.sent1: The suborners convinced the witness to lie in court.
meanings.sent2: The judge sentenced the suborners to prison for their illegal actions.
meanings.sent3: The suborners tried to trick the jury into believing false testimony.
meanings.sent4: The suborners were like puppet masters pulling the strings of deceit.
meanings.sent5: The image of the suborners whispering lies was etched in the witness's mind.

meanings.definition: To induce someone to commit perjury or other crimes.
meanings.sent1: The criminal suborners coerced the vulnerable individual into perjury.
meanings.sent2: The defense attorney was accused of suborning witnesses to lie on the stand.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous suborners plotted to fabricate evidence against their rival.
meanings.sent4: The corrupt official suborners manipulated the truth for their own gain.
meanings.sent5: The act of suborning others to commit crimes left a stain on their conscience.
